result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jay T. White Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jay T. White in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Defendant Jay T. White in custody.  Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:37 PM.  Also called 16CF56. State - resolved - on 16CF56 - plead to count #1 as alleged and dismiss #2, cost of $264.00 for Forest County Drug Task Force and costs and DRI 16CF53 entirely, have complied with victim notification requirements with no response. White and Lynch agree. Court dismisses and reads in all counts on 16CF53. Court dismisses count #2 on 16CF56. White pleads NC to count #1 on 16CF56 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - follow joint recommendation - states that the money could be restitution as opposed to costs for stated reasons. Lynch - follow joint recommendation. White makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: costs - paid due 60 days after release from custody/CO - which is 90 more days, restitution of $264.00 made payable to Forest County Drug Task Force - take bond posted, submit DNA sample with expunction right, right to appeal, adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 25, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 25, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Final pre-trial on April 13, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jay T. White in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:13 AM. Called 16CF53 & 16CF56. State - doing a waiver of PH today due to an offer extended provided the restitution is paid in full prior to the next court date. White and Lynch agree. Court has waiver of PH forms for both cases, goes thru them, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH on each case, finds probable cause on both cases, binds over for trial on both cases. State has filed Information for both matters that mirrors the complaint. Lynch has both Informations, waives reading of them, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all charges on all counts. Court accepts NG pleas, continues bond on both cases and sets both cases for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jay T. White in custody who appears via video from FOSO with attorney Chad Lynch appearing in court. Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:59 AM. Called 16CF53 & 16CF56. Lynch is aware of complaint as is White for both cases, request PH within 10 days on each case. Court continues bond on both matters and sets both matters for PH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 30, 2016 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Jay T. White in court, in custody who appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:03 AM. Called 16CF53 & 16CF56. White does not have complaints. State will provide defendant with complaints. Court reads charges and penalties for both cases, right to attorney and court appointed attorney. White understands all charges, wants an attorney, cannot afford his own, will call SPD. Court instructs to contact SPD. State - bond - $500.00 signature bond on each case, sets both matters for AIA.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 09:15 am.
Initial appearance on March 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.
